thread.title: Civic body decides on alternate parking sites
thread.title_full: Civic body decides on alternate parking sites

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Civic body decides on alternate parking sites
text:
Rajinder Nagarkoti
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 17
To manage festive rush in markets, the Municipal Corporation today identified government schools, community centres, hospital, dispensaries, and Apni Mandi grounds as alternate parking sites for visitors in Sector 15, 19 and 22. The MC has already decided that parking areas in the markets of Sectors 15, 19 and 22 will be kept free from vehicles. Restrictions will come into force on October 27 and continue till November 11 (Diwali). With the new arrangement, the MC can accommodate nearly 1,000 vehicles in these alternate parking sites. For Sector 15, the Municipal Corporation today identified Government Model Senior Secondary School, Apni Mandi ground, DAV School and outside DAV School and the Community Centre. Similarly, for Sector 19, the parking will be allowed in Government Senior Secondary School, Government Model School, Deaf and Dumb School, and the Community Centre. In Sector 22, the MC will make arrangements for parking in the government dispensary, Government Veterinary Hospital and Government School. The decision was taken today at a meeting held under the chairmanship of MC Commissioner Bhawna Garg and attended by MC Joint Commissioner Virender Chaudhary and other MC officials. For better implementation of orders, the MC has also sent a communication in this regard to the Deputy Commissioner, SDM (Central, East and South), UT SSP and SSP (Traffic), DPI (Schools), Director (Health Services), Director (Animal Husbandry), MC Chief Engineer and to the management of schools concerned.
